Name: Tom Collins
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered orange slice wheel & Luxardo Maraschino Cherry (sail).
TOP with soda and briefly stir.
Review: A medium-dry Gin Collins based on old tom gin. There is much confusion between Tom Collins and John Collins ; arguably, the two names are interchangeable [see history below]. However, I follow the convention that a Tom Collins is based on old tom gin while a John Collins is made with London dry gin (although a John Collins was originally made with genever. Today, that's a Dutch or Genever Collins ).
History: In his 1948 The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks , David A. Embury says " The original Collinses were always made with gin but, strangely enough, never with London dry gin - the very liquor that is practically always used in making a Collins today.
